Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Skinny \Skin"ny\, a. Consisting, or chiefly consisting, of skin; wanting flesh. ``Her skinny lips.'' --Shak. [1913 Webster]
He holds him with a skinny hand. --Coleridge. [1913 Webster]

skinny adj : having unattractive thinness; "a child with skinny freckled legs"; "a long scrawny neck" [syn: {scraggy}, {scrawny}, {underweight}, {weedy}] n : confidential information about a topic or person; "he wanted the inside skinny on the new partner" [also: {skinniest}, {skinnier}]
